results.title: Road to security
results.creator_credit: Roy A. Driver and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: Outlines briefly the history and general principles of insurance and shows the work of insurance companies in accepting risks and providing security against fire, accidents, personal injury, marine and general property loss.
results.description: Outlines briefly the history and general principles of insurance and shows the work of insurance companies in accepting risks and providing security against fire, accidents, personal injury, marine and general property loss.

results.title: Road to Canterbury
results.creator_credit: David Eady, British Lion Films and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: This great Roman thoroughfare was the path of the medieval pilgrims described in Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales. Evoking memories of Shakespeare and Dickens, the camera follows the road from St Paul’s Cathedral in London, through towns and villages and the Kentish orchards and hopfields to Canterbury Cathedral which St Augustine made the centre of Christianity in England nearly 1400 years ago.

results.title: Road to Canterbury
results.brief_description: Malcolm Muggeridge, follows the Pilgrim’s Way from Southwark to Canterbury Cathedral, a route made famous in Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales. It traverses the whole range of 20th century England from the slums, through new housing estates to historic towns. The group discusses the question “Is a belief in God important today?” and visit some institutions on their way to try and help find the answer.

results.title: Road to Alice
results.creator_credit: Stavros Andonis Efthymiou and Frances McGivern
results.brief_description: Jimmy’s attempted escape from the threatening Louis who wants a dept repaid takes him into the outback. But it may as well be around the block, as Louis seems to know exactly where Jimmy is headed. This black comedy is a road movie which playfully engages with genre’s conventions. Fortuitous encounters along the way are casual yet quirkily loaded, almost predestined, as the surprise twist at the end of the journey reveals. Cast includes Noah Taylor and Hugo Weaving.

display_values: Amateur & Student Films → Student films - Australia

results.title: Road sense. Part 4
results.creator_credit: Michael McCarthy, Richard F. Tambling, Ronald H. Riley and Verity Films
results.brief_description:
Made for Army Driver Training Establishments, Road Sense, made up of four short films, deals, from the driver’s seat, with some of the problems and faults encountered on the roads. The films are intended for screening during a course on driving instruction with a view to stressing the importance of care and concentration.
The fourth part deals with driving in traffic, emergency action and night driving.

results.title: Road sense. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Michael McCarthy, Richard F. Tambling, Ronald H. Riley and Verity Films
results.brief_description:
Made for Army Driver Training Establishments, Road Sense, made up of four short films, deals, from the driver’s seat, with some of the problems and faults encountered on the roads. The films are intended for screening during a course on driving instruction with a view to stressing the importance of care and concentration.
The third part deals with bends; children, animals, cyclists and other unpredictable road users.

results.title: Road sense. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Michael McCarthy, Richard F. Tambling, Ronald H. Riley and Verity Films
results.brief_description:
Made for Army Driver Training Establishments, Road Sense, made up of four short films, deals, from the driver’s seat, with some of the problems and faults encountered on the roads. The films are intended for screening during a course on driving instruction with a view to stressing the importance of care and concentration.
The second deals with the importance of signals, road position of vehicles, and the hazards of overtaking.

results.title: Road sense. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Michael McCarthy, Richard F. Tambling, Ronald H. Riley and Verity Films
results.brief_description:
Made for Army Driver Training Establishments, Road Sense, made up of four short films, deals, from the driver’s seat, with some of the problems and faults encountered on the roads. The films are intended for screening during a course on driving instruction with a view to stressing the importance of care and concentration.
The first opens with a leading truck driver attributing good driving to care on the roads, and follows with some shots of typically careless driving ending with a crash. .
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael McCarthy, Richard F. Tambling, Ronald H. Riley and Verity Films

results.title: Road manners
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the need for clear hand signals, both to keep the roads safe and as part of good driving manners. Of historic value. Filmed in Lane Cove, Sydney and features several shots of Australia’s beloved Holden.
results.description: Demonstrates the need for clear hand signals, both to keep the roads safe and as part of good driving manners. Of historic value. Filmed in Lane Cove, Sydney and features several shots of Australia’s beloved Holden.

results.title: Road lore
results.brief_description: The rules of the road are simple. If the motorist observes them they will drive well and safely. David Mackay, racing driver, explains “road lore” and how to practice it.
